ch.lambdaj.function.aggregate
Class Concat

java.lang.Object
  ch.lambdaj.function.aggregate.Concat
All Implemented Interfaces:
Aggregator<java.lang.Object>
public class Concat
extends java.lang.Object
implements Aggregator<java.lang.Object>

An Aggregator that concats String or more generally the String representation of a given Object

Author:
Mario Fusco

Constructor Summary
Concat()
          Creates an aggregator that concats Strings using the default separator \", \"
Concat(java.lang.String separator)
          Creates an aggregator that concats Strings using the given separator
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.Object aggregate(java.util.Iterator<?> iterator)
          Aggregates two object by concatenating their String representation separating them with the choosen separator.

Creates an aggregator that concats Strings using the given separator

Parameters:
separator - The string used to separate two concatenated Strings
Method Detail

aggregate

public java.lang.Object aggregate(java.util.Iterator<?> iterator)
Aggregates two object by concatenating their String representation separating them with the choosen separator. It has been implemented a custom implementation for this method instead of using the one provided by the PairAggregator for performance reason, in order to levarege the StringBuilder features.

Specified by:
aggregate in interface Aggregator<java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
iterator - The objects of which the String representation should be concatenated
Returns:
A String resulting of the objects Stringification separated by the given argument
